title: Match message card background to page background and render emoji rain above content

requirements.text: Update the Hug Day greeting page styling so the message card area uses the same background color/gradient as the page background (remove the visible white card background contrast), while keeping all existing text content and the photo in its current position and size.

quotes: But I want the color of that page where it's written to be the color of the background and the white color and the background color to be same. And I want the photo in the place wherever it is right now.

acceptanceCriteria: The message card container no longer renders with a white background that contrasts against the page background.
The page background and the message/card background visually match (same background color/gradient).
The photo remains in the same location within the layout as before (no reordering or relocation), and the text content is unchanged.

requirements.text: Render the floating emoji/hearts rain as a visual overlay above the greeting page content (over the text and over the photo) without blocking user interactions.

quotes: And I want the emoji rain to be over the text, over the photo.

acceptanceCriteria: Floating emojis/hearts appear on top of the heading, message text, signature, and photo (not behind them).
The emoji overlay remains non-interactive (clicks/taps still work normally on the page; the emoji layer does not capture pointer events).
The existing emoji burst/spawn behavior remains unchanged (initial burst, continuous spawning cadence, and click burst).

constraints: Do not change the greeting message text or the image URL.
Do not move the photo from its current position in the layout.
nonGoals: Adding new pages, navigation, or additional features beyond the single greeting screen.
